KICKING THE CAN.Definition: to avoid or delay dealing with a problem, e.g. I don't think we should kick the can down the road and let our grandkids solve that problem

EXISTENTIAL.Definition: relating to existence or being alive

COUNTERACT.Definition: to reduce or remove the effect of something unwanted by producing an opposite effect, e.g. Drinking a lot of water counteracts the dehydrating effects of hot weather

INITIATIVES.Definition: a new plan or process to achieve something or solve a problem

ABSORB.Definition: to take in a liquid, gas, or chemical

FINANCING.Definition: to provide the money needed for something to happen

CRITICS.Definition: someone who says that they do not approve of someone or something

ABSOLVED.Definition: (especially in religion or law) to free someone from guilt, blame, or responsibility for something

PURGATORY.Definition: the place to which Roman Catholics believe that the spirits of dead people go and suffer for the evil acts that they did while they were alive, before they are able to go to heaven

COMPLACENCY.Definition: a feeling of calm satisfaction with your own abilities or situation that prevents you from trying harder

APATHY.Definition: behaviour that shows no interest or energy and shows that someone is unwilling to take action, especially over something important

INCENTIVE.Definition: something that encourages a person to do something

DETER.Definition: to prevent someone from doing something or to make someone less enthusiastic about doing something by making it difficult for that person to do it or by threatening bad results if they do it

DISCOURAGE.Definition: to make someone feel less confident, enthusiastic, and positive about something, or less willing to do something

GROW OVERNIGHT.Definition: happen in a short period of time

DISTRIBUTING.Definition: to give something out to several people, or to spread or supply something

STOVES.Definition: a piece of equipment that burns fuel or uses electricity in order to heat a place

LEVELED.Definition: aimed or directed something at someone or something

OPERATORS.Definition: a company that does a particular type of business

SULLIED.Definition: to spoil something that is pure or someone's perfect reputation

RIGOROUS.Definition: careful to look at or consider every part of something to make certain it is correct or safe

ACCREDITATIONS.Definition: official approval, esp. in order to maintain satisfactory standards

CLAMP DOWN.Definition: to take strong action to stop or limit a harmful or unwanted activity

ONE SIZE FITS ALL.Definition: (intended to be) suitable for everyone or every purpose

INEVITABLY.Definition: certain to happen and unable to be avoided or prevented

OVER AND ABOVE.Definition: above or higher than something else, sometimes so that one thing covers the other

SKIMMING OVER.Definition: to read or consider something quickly in order to understand the main points, without studying it in detail

TENUOUS.Definition: weak and possibly does not exist
